tasks.title: Setup Project Repository

tasks.title: Configure Supabase Backend
tasks.description: Set up Supabase project and configure the `meetings` table with required columns.
tasks.details:
Create a new Supabase project. Define the `meetings` table with columns: id (UUID), title (text), time (timestamp), content (text), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp). Enable row-level security if required. Install Supabase JS SDK v2.39.0+.
<info added on 2025-07-07T18:46:08.872Z>
✅ Successfully completed task 2 - Supabase Backend Configuration:

**What was accomplished:**
- Created Supabase client configuration in `src/lib/supabase.ts` with both regular and admin clients
- Defined comprehensive database types in `src/types/database.ts` with proper TypeScript interfaces
- Created SQL migration file `supabase/migrations/001_create_meetings_table.sql` with:
  - Complete meetings table schema (id, title, time, content, created_at, updated_at)
  - Automatic updated_at trigger functionality
  - Row Level Security (RLS) enabled with basic policies
  - Performance indexes on time and created_at columns
- Built utility functions in `src/lib/meetings.ts` for all CRUD operations:
  - getAllMeetings() - fetch all meetings ordered by time
  - getMeetingById() - fetch single meeting
  - createMeeting() - create new meeting
  - updateMeeting() - update existing meeting
  - deleteMeeting() - delete meeting
- Created comprehensive setup documentation in `supabase/README.md`
- Configured proper TypeScript types for type-safe database operations

**Key technical decisions:**
- Used UUID for primary keys with auto-generation
- Implemented automatic timestamp management with triggers
- Set up Row Level Security for future authentication integration
- Created type-safe wrapper functions that convert between database and application types
- Used environment variables for secure credential management

**Ready for:** The backend is now fully configured and ready for frontend integration. Next tasks can safely use the database utility functions.
</info added on 2025-07-07T18:46:08.872Z>
tasks.testStrategy: Verify table creation and schema in Supabase dashboard. Test basic CRUD operations using the Supabase JS SDK in a test script.

tasks.title: Implement Authentication (Optional MVP)
tasks.description: Add user authentication using Supabase Auth if required for MVP.
tasks.details: Configure Supabase Auth. Implement login/logout UI and protect routes as needed. Use Supabase JS SDK for authentication.
tasks.testStrategy: Test user sign-up, login, and logout. Verify protected routes are inaccessible without authentication.

tasks.title: Design Meeting Minutes Table UI
tasks.description: Create a responsive table component to display meeting minutes.
tasks.details: Use Tailwind CSS for styling. Implement a table with columns for Meeting Title and Meeting Time. Make rows clickable. Ensure the table is responsive and accessible.
tasks.testStrategy: Test table rendering, responsiveness, and click behavior on different devices. Verify accessibility with keyboard navigation.

tasks.title: Implement Drawer Component
tasks.description: Create a reusable drawer component for viewing and editing meeting minutes.
tasks.details: Use Hero UI or custom drawer with Tailwind CSS. Ensure the drawer slides in from the right and overlays the table. Add close and cancel buttons.
tasks.testStrategy: Test drawer opening/closing, overlay behavior, and button functionality. Verify accessibility.

tasks.title: Fetch and Display Meeting Minutes
tasks.description: Fetch meeting minutes from Supabase and display them in the table.
tasks.details: Use Supabase JS SDK to fetch all meetings. Map data to the table component. Handle loading and error states.
tasks.testStrategy: Test data fetching, table population, and error handling. Verify empty state and loading indicators.

tasks.title: Implement Meeting Minutes Detail View
tasks.description: Display a single meeting minute in read-only Markdown format in the drawer.
tasks.details: Use `react-markdown` v8.0.7+ to render Markdown content. Open drawer on row click. Keep table visible in background.
tasks.testStrategy: Test drawer opens with correct content. Verify Markdown rendering and table persistence.

tasks.title: Add Edit Mode to Drawer
tasks.description: Enable editing of meeting minutes in the drawer with WYSIWYG Markdown editor and live preview.
tasks.details: Add edit icon to drawer. Toggle between read-only and edit modes. Use `@uiw/react-md-editor` v3.23.0+ for WYSIWYG editing and live preview. Pre-fill fields with existing data.
tasks.testStrategy: Test edit mode toggle, editor functionality, and live preview. Verify data pre-filling.

tasks.title: Implement Add New Meeting Minute Flow
tasks.description: Add a button to open a drawer for creating new meeting minutes.
tasks.details: Add 'Add Meeting Minutes' button. Open drawer with empty fields. Use WYSIWYG editor and live preview. Include Meeting Title, Meeting Time (datetime picker), and Meeting Content fields.
tasks.testStrategy: Test button click, drawer opening, and field validation. Verify editor and preview functionality.

tasks.title: Save New Meeting Minute to Supabase
tasks.description: Save new meeting minutes to the Supabase database.
tasks.details: On save, send data to Supabase using the JS SDK. Close drawer on success. Update table with new row.
tasks.testStrategy: Test data submission, error handling, and table update. Verify drawer closes on success.

tasks.title: Update Existing Meeting Minute in Supabase
tasks.description: Update existing meeting minutes in the Supabase database.
tasks.details: On save in edit mode, update the record in Supabase. Close drawer and update table.
tasks.testStrategy: Test record update, error handling, and table refresh. Verify drawer closes on success.

tasks.title: Implement Error Handling and Notifications
tasks.description: Add inline notifications for network or database errors.
tasks.details: Use toast notifications or custom UI for error messages. Handle Supabase and network errors gracefully.
tasks.testStrategy: Test error scenarios (e.g., network failure, invalid data). Verify notifications are displayed.

tasks.title: Ensure Responsive Design
tasks.description: Make the application fully responsive for mobile, tablet, and desktop.
tasks.details: Use Tailwind CSS responsive utilities. Test all components and layouts on different screen sizes.
tasks.testStrategy: Test UI on various devices and screen sizes. Verify all interactions work as expected.

tasks.title: Implement Keyboard Accessibility
tasks.description: Ensure all drawers and buttons are accessible via keyboard.
tasks.details: Add keyboard event listeners for drawer and button interactions. Use ARIA attributes for accessibility.
tasks.testStrategy: Test all interactions using keyboard only. Verify focus management and ARIA compliance.

tasks.title: Add Cancel Button to Drawer
tasks.description: Add a cancel button to the drawer for discarding changes.
tasks.details: Add cancel button next to save. Close drawer without saving on cancel.
tasks.testStrategy: Test cancel button functionality. Verify drawer closes and changes are discarded.

tasks.title: Optimize Data Fetching and Caching
tasks.description: Optimize data fetching and implement client-side caching for better performance.
tasks.details: Use SWR or React Query for data fetching and caching. Invalidate cache on updates.
tasks.testStrategy: Test data fetching performance and cache invalidation. Verify UI updates correctly.

tasks.title: Add Row-Level Security (Optional)
tasks.description: Implement row-level security in Supabase if required.
tasks.details: Configure row-level security policies in Supabase. Test with different user roles.
tasks.testStrategy: Test access control with different users. Verify only authorized users can access data.

tasks.title: Final Testing and Documentation
tasks.description: Perform end-to-end testing and update project documentation.
tasks.details: Write end-to-end tests using Cypress or Playwright. Update README and inline documentation.
